item.title: Sidney add a quote by Mary Kay Ash
item.description: "Aerodynamically, the bumble bee shouldn't be able to fly, but the bumble bee doesn't know it so it goes on flying anyway." -- Mary Kay Ash

item.title: Sidney add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "If one cannot enjoy reading a book over and over again, there is no use in reading it at all." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "But I believe in true love, you know? I don't believe that everybody gets to keep their eyes or not get sick or whatever, but everybody should have true love, and it should last at least as long as your life does." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "As he read, I fell in love the way you fall asleep: slowly, and then all at once." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "My thoughts are stars I cannot fathom into constellations." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You don't get to choose if you get hurt in this world...but you do have some say in who hurts you. I like my choices." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Saying 'I notice you're a nerd' is like saying, 'Hey, I notice that you'd rather be intelligent than be stupid, that you'd rather be thoughtful than be vapid, that you believe that there are things that matter more than the arrest record of Lindsay Lohan. Why is that?' In fact, it seems to me that most contemporary insults are pretty lame. Even 'lame' is kind of lame. Saying 'You're lame' is like saying 'You walk with a limp.' Yeah, whatever, so does 50 Cent, and he's done all right for himself." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by Jodi Picoult
item.description: "You don't love someone because they're perfect, you love them in spite of the fact that they're not." -- Jodi Picoult

item.title: Sidney add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description:
"The Road Not Taken
Two roads diverged in a yellow wood, And sorry I could not travel both And be one traveler, long I stood And looked down one as far as I could To where it bent in the undergrowth;
Then took the other, as just as fair, And having perhaps the better claim, Because it was grassy and wanted wear; Though as for that the passing there Had worn them really about the same,
And both that morning equally lay In leaves no step had trodden black. Oh, I kept the first for another day! Yet knowing how way leads on to way, I doubted if I should ever come back.
I shall be telling this with a sigh Somewhere ages and ages hence: Two roads diverged in a wood, and Iâ€” I took the one less traveled by, And that has made all the difference." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "There are infinite numbers between 0 and 1. There's .1 and .12 and .112 and an infinite collection of others. Of course, there is a bigger infinite set of numbers between 0 and 2, or between 0 and a million. Some infinities are bigger than other infinities. A writer we used to like taught us that. There are days, many of them, when I resent the size of my unbounded set. I want more numbers than I'm likely to get, and God, I want more numbers for Augustus Waters than he got. But, Gus, my love, I cannot tell you how thankful I am for our little infinity. I wouldn't trade it for the world. You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "In a good bookroom you feel in some mysterious way that you are absorbing the wisdom contained in all the books through your skin, without even opening them." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I wanted so badly to lie down next to her on the couch, to wrap my arms around her and sleep. Not fuck, like in those movies. Not even have sex. Just sleep together in the most innocent sense of the phrase. But I lacked the courage and she had a boyfriend and I was gawky and she was gorgeous and I was hopelessly boring and she was endlessly fascinating. So I walked back to my room and collapsed on the bottom bunk, thinking that if people were rain, I was drizzle and she was hurricane." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "What is the point of being alive if you don't at least try to do something remarkable?" -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "â€¦because nerds like us are allowed to be unironically enthusiastic about stuffâ€¦ Nerds are allowed to love stuff, like jump-up-and-down-in-the-chair-canâ€™t-control-yourself love it. Hank, when people call people nerds, mostly what theyâ€™re saying is â€˜you like stuff.â€™ Which is just not a good insult at all. Like, â€˜you are too enthusiastic about the miracle of human consciousnessâ€™." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
Sidney add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "Love the world and yourself in it, move through it as though it offers no resistance, as though the world is your natural element." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Sidney add a quote by Audrey Niffenegger
item.description: "I'm sorry. I didn't know you were coming or I'd have cleaned up a little more. My life, I mean, not just the apartment." -- Audrey Niffenegger

item.title: Sidney add a quote by Sara Gruen
item.description: "Keeping up the appearance of having all your marbles is hard work, but important." -- Sara Gruen

item.title: Sidney add a quote by Joss Whedon
item.description: "Very occasionally, if you pay really close attention, life doesn't suck." -- Joss Whedon

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Sometimes, you read a book and it fills you with this weird evangelical zeal, and you become convinced that the shattered world will never be put back together unless and until all living humans read the book." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Some infinities are bigger than other infinities." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Oh, I wouldn't mind, Hazel Grace. It would be a privilege to have my heart broken by you." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You gave me a forever within the numbered days, and I'm grateful." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I was blind and heart broken and didn't want to do anything and Gus burst into my room and shouted, "I have wonderful news!" And I was like, "I don't really want to hear wonderful news right now," and Gus said, "This is wonderful news you want to hear," and I asked him, "Fine, what is it?" and he said, "You are going to live a good and long life filled with great and terrible moments that you cannot even imagine yet!" -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description:
"He responded a few minutes later.
Okay.
I wrote back.
Okay.
He responded:
Oh, my God, stop flirting with me!" -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "You're arguing that the fragile, rare thing is beautiful simply because it is fragile and rare. But that's a lie, and you know it." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "I had a moral opposition to eating before dawn on the grounds that I was not a nineteenth-century Russian peasant fortifying myself for a day in the fields." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "If you don't live a life in service of a greater good, you've gotta at least die a death in service of a greater good, you know? And I fear that I won't get either a life or a death that means anything." -- John Green

item.title: Sidney add a quote by John Green
item.description: "Is it still cool to go to the mall?' she asked. 'I take quite a lot of pride in not knowing what's cool,' I answered." -- John Green
